text.p: Premier BancShares Inc and Central and Southern Holding Co said Tuesday said they had entered into a definitive agreement to merge through a stock swap.
A merger would create a company with combined assets as of December 31, 1996, of $520 million, they said.
Under the pact, Premier will undertake a 1.8-for-one stock split, after which shares of Central and Southern would be exchanged on a one-for-one basis for shares of Premier.
The transaction will result in Central and Southern shareholders receiving about 46 percent of the combined institution's 7.9 million shares outstanding.
Shares of Premier, formerly known as First Alliance/Premier Bancshares Inc, ended Monday at 23-7/8. Central and Southern closed at 12-7/8, up 3/4.
A Central and Southern spokesman said the deal would essentially be a merger of equals with "no collars or ceilings or floors" on the companies' stock prices.
The deal is expected to close in the second quarter and is subject to approval by regulatory authorities and stockholders of both companies.
